programme.title: Stillwater
programme.desc: Humble family man Bill Baker contends with the unthinkable when his daughter calls him from a French prison, revealing that she has been charged with murder. Determined to prove his daughter's innocence to the French courts and secure her freedom he embarks on an odyssey from rural Oklahoma to France driven by paternal instinct.

programme.title: The Circle
programme.desc: A young woman lands a job at a social-media company that preaches the value of complete transparency and inspires a cult-like devotion in its employees. However, she learns that they're hiding a nefarious agenda in this timely and unnerving thriller.

programme.title: Margaux
programme.desc: Eager for a weekend getaway of parties and relaxation, a group of twentysomethings rents a smart home vacation rental. Yet the home's sophisticated artificial intelligence programming system soon takes control, forcing the friends to fight their way out or face their end.

programme.title: Jerry & Marge Go Large
programme.desc: Jerry Selbee stumbles upon a mathematical hole in the Massachusetts lottery and recruits his wife, Marge, to help him secure the hefty cash prize.

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Running away together isn't as easy as George and Tammy imagined.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: In a special Halloween episode, Micah finds a queer role model with a familiar face, while a new face comes to town and helps Dani and Sophie break out of their funk. Meanwhile, Alice tests the waters of her new relationship, until scary movie night becomes a little too scary. Shocking truths come to light when the masks come off.

programme.title: Wifelike
programme.desc: An artificially intelligent being named Meredith receives her latest assignment as a companion to widower William. An anti-android exploitation advocacy group alters Meredith's programming and she starts remembering a past life she never knew she had. What follows is a deep dive into the nature of reality, existence, and what it means to be truly human.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Ziwe explores the triumphs and failures of diversity in the workplace with Amber Riley and sends a writer to host an iconic diversity training with a group of opinionated employees. Featuring iconic guests Josh Sharp, Marie Faustin, Michelle Davis, and Ike Ufomadu.

programme.title: National Lampoon's Dirty Movie
programme.desc: A washed up CEO teams up with a producer to create what they hope will be the wildest comedy movie ever.

programme.title: Best of All the Smoke with Matt Barnes and Stephen Jackson
McEnroe
programme.desc: The story of a legend told by the legend himself: John McEnroe. Nobody embodied the rockstar era of tennis more than John McEnroe. The original bad boy of the sport, McEnroe was famous not only for his epic matches, but also for his confrontations on and off the court. Accompanied by interviews with icons like Patty Smyth, Keith Richards, Billie Jean King, and Bjorn Borg, the legendary tennis ace gives an unflinching account of his triumphs, struggles, friendships, and rivalries.

programme.title: Last Vegas
programme.desc: Four geriatric friends head to Las Vegas for a bachelor party that recaptures the magic of their glory days in this outrageous all-star comedy.

programme.title: Snake Eyes
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this highly stylized 1998 thriller directed by Brain De Palma. Cage plays a crooked cop investigating the assassination of the Secretary of Defense, who was shot at a championship boxing match in Atlantic City. As the investigation proceeds, he is forced to realizes that one of his closest friends (Gary Sinise), a Navy commander, may have been involved.

programme.title: Blown Away
programme.desc: A Boston demolition expert is the target of a former colleague, a prison escapee from Ireland aiming to settle a score.

programme.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
programme.desc: Writer-director Shane Black (who wrote "Lethal Weapon") puts a killer spin on this slam-bang salute to old-school noir detective yarns. Robert Downey Jr. and Val Kilmer are superb as a hapless hood and a gay PI looking into a mysterious death involving the sister of Downey's high-school crush (Michelle Monaghan). This is Black's directorial debut, and he tips his hat to pulp master Raymond Chandler by naming each chapter of the film after a Chandler book title.

programme.title: Confess, Fletch
programme.desc: Confess, Fletch is a reboot of the classic crime-comedy film. This time, Fletch becomes the main suspect in a series of murders while investigating thieves that stole his girlfriend's art collection. To exonerate himself, Fletch begins his own investigation into the murders and discovers a lot of people could be the guilty party, including his art collecting girlfriend.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: Grappling with the onset of middle age, a Chinese immigrant discovers that she can traverse across time and space. Teaming up with her alternate lives, the unlikely allies realize that they alone possess the power to protect the world from calamity, plunging them into the midst of an outlandish quest.

programme.title: Contagion
programme.desc: In this intense ensemble thriller about a virus that quickly becomes a global pandemic, a husband (Matt Damon) copes with the sudden death of his wife, while a doctor (Kate Winslet) puts herself at risk to find a cure and an activist blogger (Jude Law) stokes society's paranoia. Directed by Steven Soderbergh.

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Running away together isn't as easy as George and Tammy imagined.

programme.title: Boogie Nights
programme.desc: Exploration of the adult-film industry in the '70s and early '80s, about the rags-to-riches career of a naive teen who's transformed into a star by a wily producer.

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Running away together isn't as easy as George and Tammy imagined.

programme.title: Let the Right One In
programme.desc: Mark and Eleanor turn to Claire and Peter for help, but soon realize they may have a plan of their own. Meanwhile, Naomi and her new partner, Debra, make strides in their case, and Naomi uncovers a huge secret.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: Grappling with the onset of middle age, a Chinese immigrant discovers that she can traverse across time and space. Teaming up with her alternate lives, the unlikely allies realize that they alone possess the power to protect the world from calamity, plunging them into the midst of an outlandish quest.

programme.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!
programme.desc: Wildly inept L.A. cop Frank Drebin tries to foil a plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II. Inspired by the 1982 TV series, itself a spoof of detective stories.

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear
programme.desc: Inept police lieutenant Frank Drebin is back at it in this sequel. While at a White House reception honoring him for shooting his 1000th drug dealer, Drebin becomes tied up in a conspiracy to replace President George Bush's energy advisor with a clone who will support the agenda of evil energy lobbyists.

programme.title: Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure
programme.desc: Two dim best friends who dream of being famous rock stars time-travel in order to bring ancient figures to modern times so that they can pass a history class and graduate. If they fail, one of them will be forced to join the military.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey
programme.desc: Bill and Ted's lyrics create a utopian future, so a tyrant sends evil robot versions of the simple-minded heroes back in time to kill them. Bill and Ted end up in the afterlife, and must outsmart the Grim Reaper in order to return to the land of the living to stop their evil counterparts and save their girlfriends.

programme.title: NYC Point Gods
programme.desc: Against the backdrop of New York City's epidemic of drugs and crime in the 1980s and 1990s, a unique style of basketball emerged on the city's courts, defined by toughness, talent and swagger.

programme.title: Teen Wolf
programme.desc: A misfit, picked-on teen's life turns around when he discovers he's descendant from a line of werewolves. By unleashing his inner beast, he becomes a basketball star, and works up the courage to try and win his dream girl away from her unpleasant boyfriend.

programme.title: Major League
programme.desc: Misfits try to lift the Cleveland Indians out of a 34-year slump.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: The third installment of the electrifying "Twilight" saga finds Bella (Kristen Stewart) forced to choose between Edward (Robert Pattinson), a vampire and the love of her life, or Jacob Black (Taylor Lautner), a werewolf and her best friend. The result of her decision may reignite the ancient feud between vampires and werewolves, while a scorned vampire bent on revenge appears responsible for a string of brutal murders

programme.title: DIO: Dreamers Never Die
programme.desc: The narrative covers the career of heavy metal icon Ronnie James Dio. From his early beginnings in the 1950s as a doo-wop singer to his rise as a sought-after front man culminating in going solo, every aspect of Dio's career is covered. The retrospective includes interviews with family, friends, colleagues, band members, and peers and is the only estate-authorized documentary to cover Dio's entire career.

programme.title: Contagion
programme.desc: In this intense ensemble thriller about a virus that quickly becomes a global pandemic, a husband (Matt Damon) copes with the sudden death of his wife, while a doctor (Kate Winslet) puts herself at risk to find a cure and an activist blogger (Jude Law) stokes society's paranoia. Directed by Steven Soderbergh.

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: The true story of German businessman Oskar Schindler, whose efforts saved the lives of more than 1000 Jews during the Holocaust. The film was nominated for 12 Oscars and won seven, including Best Picture and a Best Director award for Steven Spielberg.

programme.title: Sin City: A Dame to Kill For
programme.desc: Robert Rodriguez teams with Frank Miller to direct this scorching follow-up to "Sin City" that finds the character of Dwight getting wrapped up in the thralls of femme fatale Ava, and a mysterious gambler named Johnny on a mission to defeat a sworn foe in a high-stakes game of life and death.

programme.title: Afflicted
programme.desc: Two young travel bloggers attempting to document their journey around the world experience a bizarre encounter that leaves one of them instilled with superhuman powers in this inventive sci-fi thriller. Now, they must find the woman who infected him during a one-night stand gone awry.

programme.title: Contagion
programme.desc: In this intense ensemble thriller about a virus that quickly becomes a global pandemic, a husband (Matt Damon) copes with the sudden death of his wife, while a doctor (Kate Winslet) puts herself at risk to find a cure and an activist blogger (Jude Law) stokes society's paranoia. Directed by Steven Soderbergh.

programme.title: Teen Wolf
programme.desc: A misfit, picked-on teen's life turns around when he discovers he's descendant from a line of werewolves. By unleashing his inner beast, he becomes a basketball star, and works up the courage to try and win his dream girl away from her unpleasant boyfriend.

programme.title: Hide and Seek
programme.desc: Despite his lavish lifestyle, an affluent entrepreneur contends with uncertainty following his brother's disappearance. As he continues to investigate his brother's past, he finds himself inexorably drawn into a seedy world of gangsters, thieves, and vagabonds whose sinister designs put his family in peril.

programme.title: Montana Story
programme.desc: The story of estranged siblings Erin and Cal, who return home to their Montana ranch to take care of their comatose father. Both harbor resentment for their abusive dad, with Cal feeling guilt for being unable to protect his sister. Erin, on the other hand, hasn't been back since the blowout that caused her to run away from home. Now, the man whose influence shaped their lives has inadvertently given the two a chance at reconciliation.

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: It takes Aaron Falk 20 years to return to his hometown, and it is because Luke, one of his childhood friends, has died. Luke has killed himself after murdering his family, falling victim to the madness that is going through their area. As Falk stays to investigate the case, he opens up an old wound: the death of Ellie. He realizes that a connection can be made between the two crimes, but as he does, he finds himself needing to prove not only Luke's, but also his innocence.

programme.title: 13 Minutes
programme.desc: Deep in America's heartland, a substantial tornado touches down, wreaking havoc across a rural town and leaving the community destitute. Amidst the destruction and devastation, four close-knit families band together to survive their harsh new reality and face a future fraught with uncertainty.

programme.title: Jerry & Marge Go Large
programme.desc: Jerry Selbee stumbles upon a mathematical hole in the Massachusetts lottery and recruits his wife, Marge, to help him secure the hefty cash prize.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: This delightfully offbeat comedy centers on a single woman who decides to conceive via artificial insemination. But seven years later, she reunites with a friend and comes to question the child's paternity after he recalls a last-minute mix-up involving the sperm sample she used.

programme.title: How to Be a Latin Lover
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, a past-his-prime Latin lover moves in with his sister and her son after his wife leaves him. As he teaches his nephew how to play the game of seduction, he vows to return to his lifestyle of being a kept man for an older woman.

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a shy American saleswoman whose doctor misdiagnoses her. When she believes that death is calling, she decides to go out with a bang and heads to Europe for an extended stay at a swanky resort.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
programme.desc: The sweeping conclusion to the "Twilight" series follows Bella, Edward and Jacob as they band together to fight a group of ancient vampires who are threatening to destroy Bella and Edward's family.

programme.title: Wrong Turn
programme.desc: At the Appalachian Trail areas, Jen goes on a hike with friends. They abandon the prescribed trail and wander off into areas that, unknown to them, are occupied by The Foundation. As they are about to find out, this reclusive hidden community zealously guards their privacy and territory—to the death.

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: It takes Aaron Falk 20 years to return to his hometown, and it is because Luke, one of his childhood friends, has died. Luke has killed himself after murdering his family, falling victim to the madness that is going through their area. As Falk stays to investigate the case, he opens up an old wound: the death of Ellie. He realizes that a connection can be made between the two crimes, but as he does, he finds himself needing to prove not only Luke's, but also his innocence.

programme.title: Nothing Compares
programme.desc: An intimate look into the life of controversial Irish singer-songwriter Sinéad O'Connor. Beginning with the release of her debut album in 1987, the narrative charts six years in O'Connor's career filled with rebellion, iconoclasm, and creativity as the musician strove to rewrite the script of mainstream music and femininity in the face of rampant sociopolitical and sociocultural change.

programme.title: Hotel Artemis
programme.desc: A woman known as The Nurse runs a high-security, members-only hospital for high-rolling criminals in Los Angeles. When a bank robber brings his injured teammates along with $18 million in jewels there, a mob boss and the police both follow. With the hospital under siege, The Nurse, her orderly (Dave Bautista) and her other criminal patients have to defend themselves from outside threats as well as inside backstabbers who want to gain possession of the jewels.

programme.title: Top Secret!
programme.desc: When an American pop idol is sent to the Soviet Union on a goodwill tour, he quickly becomes engangled in espionage in an attempt to rescue a brilliant scientist held captive.

programme.title: Lamb
programme.desc: This mysterious drama is set in Iceland and follows the story of Maria and Ingvar, a couple who has been living on a faraway meadow farm, trying to cope with being childless. However, when one of the ewes in their herd gives birth to a strange lamb creature, the couple cares for it as if it were their own child. Soon, they will find out that the newborn will bring something else to their relationship.

programme.title: The Novice
programme.desc: Alex Dall, a university student, seems to be obsessing about rowing. As a member of her school's rowing team, she is seen working herself to the bones as a novice team member, often sacrificing her academics and other aspects of her life. Things change a bit when she meets Dani, a teacher's assistant who later becomes her girlfriend. However, even with love now in the equation, Alex still seems to be heading toward self-destruction in her life obsessions.

programme.title: Hello, My Name Is Doris
programme.desc: Sixtysomething spinster Doris tries to woo her much-younger coworker John in this charming comedy-drama. To her surprise, she is welcomed into John's social circle, although her new and exciting life strains her relationship with her best friend.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: Robert Harling adapted and expanded his stage hit, a character study set in small-town Louisiana that celebrates friendship among a group of strong-willed women who discuss their lives—especially the shortcomings of their men—at Truvy's beauty salon. Julia Roberts earned her first Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actress for her portrayal of stubborn Shelby. Harling costars as the minister.

programme.title: Mid90s
programme.desc: A thirteen-year-old boy finds solace in a group of older skaters in L.A. as he tries to avoid the tumultuous home life he shares with his bullish brother and despondent mother. Even as life begins to make sense, he knows this summer can't last forever in a 90s haze.

programme.title: The Mod Squad
programme.desc: The 1968-73 TV series is stylishly updated for the 1990s, with Claire Danes, Giovanni Ribisi and Omar Epps well cast as juvenile delinquents who must pay their debt to society by working as undercover officers for an LAPD detective (Dennis Farina). The plot involves the hip trio investigating a drug ring. Josh Brolin, Steve Harris, Sam McMurray, Richard Jenkins, Larry Brandenburg.

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Running away together isn't as easy as George and Tammy imagined.

programme.title: The Long Kiss Goodnight
programme.desc: Geena Davis stars in this action-packed thriller about a schoolteacher with amnesia. When a car accident triggers her memory, she teams with a PI to uncover her past, and finds she was a cold-blooded assassin for the CIA. Samuel L. Jackson, Patrick Malahide, Craig Bierko, David Morse.

programme.title: USS Indianapolis: Men of Courage
programme.desc: Riveting historical drama about the sinking of the USS Indianapolis by Japanese forces in WWII, and the travails endured by the few survivors both while adrift in the Philippine Sea and during the eventual court-martial of Captain Charles B. McVay III.

programme.title: The Kill Team
programme.desc: Private Andrew Briggman is second-in-command to Sergeant Deeks, the relentless leader of their U.S. army platoon in Afghanistan. When the young soldier becomes suspicious of his commander's decisions, he debates following his moral compass or staying loyal to his team. Based on the 2013 award-winning documentary of the same name.

programme.title: Dead in Tombstone
programme.desc: A gang overruns a small mining town, murder their own leader all for a cold-blooded power grab. Guerrero finds himself confronted by Satan offering him a proposition to deliver the six souls of his former gang and he will escape damnation.

programme.title: Love Spreads
programme.desc: Following a meteoric rise to fame, tensions rise amidst the indie band Glass Heart as their producer demands their sophomore album. With their careers on the line, three wholly different singer-songwriters experience a creative clash as they strive to write and record the new album.

programme.title: Mob Town
programme.desc: In 1957, an FBI agent teams up with a local police officer to monitor the activities of New York City's most notorious Mafia leaders as they prepare for a large-scale gathering in upstate New York. It is up to the unlikely duo to piece together the purpose of such a meeting and thwart any instances of violence that may erupt as a result.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: Who Killed Cooper Dunn?
programme.desc: Six friends embark on a camping trip. But when one of them dies, loyalties are tested as they try to find who's responsible.

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: The true story of German businessman Oskar Schindler, whose efforts saved the lives of more than 1000 Jews during the Holocaust. The film was nominated for 12 Oscars and won seven, including Best Picture and a Best Director award for Steven Spielberg.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: Let the Right One In
programme.desc: Mark and Eleanor turn to Claire and Peter for help, but soon realize they may have a plan of their own. Meanwhile, Naomi and her new partner, Debra, make strides in their case, and Naomi uncovers a huge secret.

programme.title: The Bling Ring
programme.desc: In this trenchant take on celebrity culture, a group of Los Angeles teens burglarize the homes of the rich and famous, but their criminal pastime turns treacherous as their obsession with luxury goods grows all-consuming.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: In a special Halloween episode, Micah finds a queer role model with a familiar face, while a new face comes to town and helps Dani and Sophie break out of their funk. Meanwhile, Alice tests the waters of her new relationship, until scary movie night becomes a little too scary. Shocking truths come to light when the masks come off.

programme.title: Crawlspace
programme.desc: A plumber is trapped in the crawlspace of a ruthless poachers' cabin.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Ziwe explores the triumphs and failures of diversity in the workplace with Amber Riley and sends a writer to host an iconic diversity training with a group of opinionated employees. Featuring iconic guests Josh Sharp, Marie Faustin, Michelle Davis, and Ike Ufomadu.

programme.title: Adrift
programme.desc: A young couple who's sailing 4,000 miles across the Pacific Ocean suddenly find themselves approaching a Category 5 storm with no hope of diverting. After losing consciousness, she awakes stranded on their wrecked boat, but with a determined will to survive.

programme.title: National Lampoon's Dirty Movie
programme.desc: A washed up CEO teams up with a producer to create what they hope will be the wildest comedy movie ever.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Stephenie Meyer's romantic and suspenseful best seller that started the phenomenon comes to life in this action-packed chronicle of the modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson star. Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular "Twilight" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: The third installment of the electrifying "Twilight" saga finds Bella (Kristen Stewart) forced to choose between Edward (Robert Pattinson), a vampire and the love of her life, or Jacob Black (Taylor Lautner), a werewolf and her best friend. The result of her decision may reignite the ancient feud between vampires and werewolves, while a scorned vampire bent on revenge appears responsible for a string of brutal murders

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
programme.desc: In this magical installment of the "Twilight" saga, Bella becomes pregnant after marrying Edward, which leads to a dangerous childbirth and a shocking realization for werewolf Jacob Black.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
programme.desc: The sweeping conclusion to the "Twilight" series follows Bella, Edward and Jacob as they band together to fight a group of ancient vampires who are threatening to destroy Bella and Edward's family.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Stephenie Meyer's romantic and suspenseful best seller that started the phenomenon comes to life in this action-packed chronicle of the modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson star. Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular "Twilight" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: The third installment of the electrifying "Twilight" saga finds Bella (Kristen Stewart) forced to choose between Edward (Robert Pattinson), a vampire and the love of her life, or Jacob Black (Taylor Lautner), a werewolf and her best friend. The result of her decision may reignite the ancient feud between vampires and werewolves, while a scorned vampire bent on revenge appears responsible for a string of brutal murders

programme.title: The Lighthouse
programme.desc: In the midst of a bracing storm, two lighthouse keepers fight to maintain their sanity while stranded on a strange and isolated New England island in the 1890s. But as the storm continues, the two men are forced to confront their true nature.

programme.title: Givers of Death
programme.desc: The tale unfolds from three points of view; a man, a detective, and a city in ruin, all dealing with traumas that argue against peace. At the same time, all three desperately seek it, although the means and the final goals vary. It is a tale of revenge, atonement, and resolution, where the players all want one thing: redemption.

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: This Korean take on the "Godzilla" legend is an alternately spine-tingling and rib-tickling creature feature about a dysfunctional Korean family trying to rescue their prized daughter (Ko Ah-sung), who's been snatched by a mutant monster and taken to its lair. Song Kang-ho, Bae Doo-na. Directed by Bong Joon-ho, who co-wrote the script with Baek Chul-hyun.

programme.title: X
programme.desc: In the 1970s, an adult film crew goes to a remote Texas farm to shoot a film. The elderly couple they are renting from is unaware of what the crew intends for their property. But they do take an unusual interest in the young team. When the couple discovers the real intention of the youngsters, a night of profit-making passion turns to terror as they fight for their lives against their enraged hosts.

programme.title: The Hole in the Ground
programme.desc: A single mother is haunted by the conviction that her son has been replaced by a sinister impostor after she discovers an eerie sinkhole in the neighbouring forest.Her attempt to pursue a new beginning in a rural town is thwarted by intense feelings of fear and paranoia.

programme.title: Skin
programme.desc: A white supremacist reforms his life after falling in love but saying goodbye to his skinhead life isn't a clean process. He must betray his former gang and work alongside the FBI in order to remove the body ink that has represented his identity for so long, as well as the burden of the gang's crimes he has carried.

programme.title: Welcome to the Dollhouse
programme.desc: Welcome to the nightmare that is everyday life for 11-year-old Dawn Wiener. Hated and misunderstood by nearly everyone she meets, Dawn struggles to find tiny moments of happiness in a grim life that just keeps getting grimmer. Heather Matarazzo, Brendan Sexton Jr., Matthew Faber, Daria Kalinina, Angela Pietropinto, Bill Buell, Eric Mabius, Rica Martens.

programme.title: Spotlights: A Showtime Short Film Series
programme.desc: Maia sets out to reconnect with her Mexican-American roots on her Nana's birthday, but things go terribly wrong.

programme.title: Pete Lee: Tall, Dark, and Pleasant
programme.desc: Conflict-averse comedian Pete Lee talks sex, drugs and being too nice.

programme.title: A Very British Christmas
programme.desc: American opera singer Jessica Bailey's flight to her concert in Vienna becomes delayed in a remote area of England. The only place to stay is a bed-and-breakfast in Pine Falls, an enchanting village run by a young, handsome, widower Andrew with his precocious daughter, Katie. Spending time with them allows romance to blossom as Jessica learns he is an amazing artist, but a struggling entrepreneur. With snowflakes in the air, Jessica faces a choice: career or love.

programme.title: The Match
programme.desc: It is the spring of 1944 and the Nazis are preparing to commemorate the birthday of their beloved leader, Adolf Hitler. One activity they come up with is a football match between an elite Nazi team and a ragtag team of prisoners. With the help of a former captain of the national football team, the determined team made up of ex-footballers and prisoners of war will do all they can to defeat their captors in a game where all odds are stacked against them.

programme.title: Boy
programme.desc: In this coming-of-age tale set in 1984, a Michael Jackson-obsessed Maori boy and his brother deal with unexpected problems when their ex-con father returns and tries to retrieve money from a successful robbery.

programme.title: Memphis
programme.desc: An unstable Memphis musician suffers a creative dry spell while drifting aimlessly through the city, occasionally breaking his cycle of apathy by visiting his girlfriend, dropping into the studio or hanging out with his best friend.

programme.title: Margaux
programme.desc: Eager for a weekend getaway of parties and relaxation, a group of twentysomethings rents a smart home vacation rental. Yet the home's sophisticated artificial intelligence programming system soon takes control, forcing the friends to fight their way out or face their end.

programme.title: The Circle
programme.desc: A young woman lands a job at a social-media company that preaches the value of complete transparency and inspires a cult-like devotion in its employees. However, she learns that they're hiding a nefarious agenda in this timely and unnerving thriller.

programme.title: Monstrous
programme.desc: Laura, the mother to seven-year-old Cody, decides to get a new but isolated house near a lake. They are trying to live a new life after escaping Laura's abusive ex-husband. Amidst the appeal of their life and surroundings, a new challenge appears in the form of a monstrous being that emerges from the waters near their property, haunting them in more ways than one.

programme.title: Hereditary
programme.desc: When her mentally ill mother passes away, a woman named Annie and her husband, son and daughter all mourn her loss. The family turn to different means to handle their grief, including Annie and her daughter both flirting with the supernatural. They all begin to have disturbing, otherworldly experiences linked to the sinister secrets and emotional trauma that have been passed through the generations of their family.

programme.title: Midsommar
programme.desc: Just as their relationship is on the brink of falling apart, couple Dani and Christian are brought closer by a family tragedy. The mourning Dani then joins Christian and his friends, Josh and Mark, on a trip to a rural Swedish village that is celebrating a once-in-a-blue-moon festival. As the tourists partake in the celebrations, they discover that the idyllic community holds many unnerving secrets, and it all unfolds in broad daylight.

programme.title: Through The Glass Darkly
programme.desc: In rural Georgia, Charlie finds her deepest fears thrust into reality as her daughter vanishes. When another local girl disappears one year later, Charlie begins to believe the two cases may be related. Yet her claims only arouse suspicion amongst the local authorities. Charlie then vows to uncover the hidden connection before another victim arises.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Ziwe explores the triumphs and failures of diversity in the workplace with Amber Riley and sends a writer to host an iconic diversity training with a group of opinionated employees. Featuring iconic guests Josh Sharp, Marie Faustin, Michelle Davis, and Ike Ufomadu.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: In a special Halloween episode, Micah finds a queer role model with a familiar face, while a new face comes to town and helps Dani and Sophie break out of their funk. Meanwhile, Alice tests the waters of her new relationship, until scary movie night becomes a little too scary. Shocking truths come to light when the masks come off.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: A group of dancers finish an elaborate rehearsal in an abandoned school and celebrate with an all night party. When they realize their drinks are spiked with a potent drug, the party quickly turns from celebration to chaos, as the dancers descend into complete madness.

programme.title: Demonic
programme.desc: This sci-fi horror tale finds the characters crossing the line of reality and existing in an environment where they begin to question their own existence. The story follows a woman who has long been estranged from her mother. However, during the course of a technological experiment, the paths of the mother and daughter meet again, as secrets of their lives slowly emerge while supernatural demons are accidentally unleashed by the process.

programme.title: Depeche Mode 101
programme.desc: Filmmaker D.A. Pennebaker captures the music and spirit of the English alt-rock group Depeche Mode and the vibrant fandom that surrounded the band on their 1988 world tour. The documentary climaxes with a concert at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, Cal.

programme.title: Time Now
programme.desc: A young mother returns to her estranged hometown of Detroit after the sudden death of her twin brother and immerses herself in his friend group, soon discovering that his death is not what it seems.

programme.title: Freedom Writers
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Hilary Swank stars in this powerful true story of an idealistic teacher at a tough high school in California who tries to inspire her troubled students through journal writing. Patrick Dempsey, Scott Glenn, Imelda Staunton, April Lee Hernandez. Directed by Richard LaGravenese.

programme.title: Lacy's Christmas Do-Over
programme.desc: Lacy, a career-driven business woman, goes to a B&B in Illinois at the advice of a new therapist. There she finds herself stuck in a mystical, small Christmas town, reliving the same day over and over. Lacy must figure out how to escape.

programme.title: Jules of Light and Dark
programme.desc: Two young lovers are found wrecked on the side of the road.

programme.title: Through The Glass Darkly
programme.desc: In rural Georgia, Charlie finds her deepest fears thrust into reality as her daughter vanishes. When another local girl disappears one year later, Charlie begins to believe the two cases may be related. Yet her claims only arouse suspicion amongst the local authorities. Charlie then vows to uncover the hidden connection before another victim arises.

programme.title: Robotapocalypse
programme.desc: A quirky family grapples with an incursion of sinister artificial intelligence that puts a damper on their summer road trip.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: Grappling with the onset of middle age, a Chinese immigrant discovers that she can traverse across time and space. Teaming up with her alternate lives, the unlikely allies realize that they alone possess the power to protect the world from calamity, plunging them into the midst of an outlandish quest.

programme.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
programme.desc: Writer-director Shane Black (who wrote "Lethal Weapon") puts a killer spin on this slam-bang salute to old-school noir detective yarns. Robert Downey Jr. and Val Kilmer are superb as a hapless hood and a gay PI looking into a mysterious death involving the sister of Downey's high-school crush (Michelle Monaghan). This is Black's directorial debut, and he tips his hat to pulp master Raymond Chandler by naming each chapter of the film after a Chandler book title.

programme.title: ShoBox: The New Generation
programme.desc: Prospects Shinard Bunch and Hugo Alberto Roldan clash.

programme.title: Let the Right One In
programme.desc: Mark and Eleanor turn to Claire and Peter for help, but soon realize they may have a plan of their own. Meanwhile, Naomi and her new partner, Debra, make strides in their case, and Naomi uncovers a huge secret.

programme.title: Student Body
programme.desc: Jane tries to restore her shattered friendship with Merritt, her childhood best friend. A disinterested high school administration compels Jane and Merritt to take matters into their own hands, further fracturing their relationship.

programme.title: Demonic
programme.desc: This sci-fi horror tale finds the characters crossing the line of reality and existing in an environment where they begin to question their own existence. The story follows a woman who has long been estranged from her mother. However, during the course of a technological experiment, the paths of the mother and daughter meet again, as secrets of their lives slowly emerge while supernatural demons are accidentally unleashed by the process.

programme.title: National Champions
programme.desc: With their university's reputation on the line, a football team prepares for the most critical match of their season. However, the team's charismatic and talented quarterback leads his brothers into a strike moments before kick-off, spurring a crusade for equal opportunities amongst all student athletes at their institution.

programme.title: World Trade Center
programme.desc: Harrowing and inspiring account of two New York City Port Authority policemen who became trapped under the rubble of the Twin Towers on Sept. 11, 2001, after they volunteered to go in and rescue others.

programme.title: U-571
programme.desc: A doomed German submarine is carrying a special coding device and a U.S. sub crew is sent out to rescue the vessel, but German forces have picked up the distress call and are already en route to save their comrades.

programme.title: Mine 9
programme.desc: Two miles into the earth, nine Appalachian miners struggle to survive after a methane explosion leaves them with one hour of oxygen.

programme.title: Monkey Shines
programme.desc: An experiment provides a simian aide that has been trained to assist a quadriplegic, but the man feels a strange connection with the mammal, which is exhibiting "feelings."

programme.title: It Comes at Night
programme.desc: In this unnerving horror film, a married couple and their teenage son isolate themselves from the rest of humanity when a plague throws civilization into chaos. However, their secluded existence is threatened when a young family seek shelter with them.

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: This Korean take on the "Godzilla" legend is an alternately spine-tingling and rib-tickling creature feature about a dysfunctional Korean family trying to rescue their prized daughter (Ko Ah-sung), who's been snatched by a mutant monster and taken to its lair. Song Kang-ho, Bae Doo-na. Directed by Bong Joon-ho, who co-wrote the script with Baek Chul-hyun.

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Best Picture winner about an FBI trainee (Best Actress Jodie Foster), who has a knack for analyzing serial killers, and enlists the aid of an imprisoned, cannibalistic sociopath (Best Actor Anthony Hopkins) in tracking a sadistic murderer. An Oscar went to director Jonathan Demme and also Ted Tally won for Best Adapted Screenplay for his script based on the Thomas Harris novel.

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Moody crime drama about a detective with a haunted past. Her probe of a grisly killing points to two high-schoolers who have done their homework when it comes to pulling off a "perfect murder."

programme.title: Bellator MMA
programme.desc: Irish star Peter Queally vs. Benson Henderson from Dublin.

programme.title: Modern Vampires
programme.desc: This variation on the "Dracula" theme makes Los Angeles the backdrop as the undead infiltrate Hollywood's nightlife, provoking the wrath of vampire hunter Dr. Van Helsing (Rod Steiger). Casper Van Dien. Nico: Natasha Wagner. The Count: Robert Pastorelli. Vincent: Udo Kier. Rachel: Natasha Lyonne. Directed by Richard Elfman.

programme.title: Sound of Violence
programme.desc: A young woman experiments with unusual soundscapes and graphic violence to try to satisfy her synesthesia cravings after a horrific past trauma leads her to realize that violence and killing enable her to see music in a sixth sense style experience.

programme.title: Robotapocalypse
programme.desc: A quirky family grapples with an incursion of sinister artificial intelligence that puts a damper on their summer road trip.

programme.title: Spotlights: A Showtime Short Film Series
programme.desc: A woman's lust for virtue thrusts her family into a sacrificial slaughter.

programme.title: Monstrous
programme.desc: Laura, the mother to seven-year-old Cody, decides to get a new but isolated house near a lake. They are trying to live a new life after escaping Laura's abusive ex-husband. Amidst the appeal of their life and surroundings, a new challenge appears in the form of a monstrous being that emerges from the waters near their property, haunting them in more ways than one.

programme.title: The Hanoi Hilton
programme.desc: A group of POW'S, captives inside Hanoi's Hoa prison during the Vietnam War, endure some brutal lessons in the art of survival and find dignity in the bargain.

programme.title: Gunfight at Dry River
programme.desc: Set in the Old West of 1888, on the US-Mexican border, a small town slowly perishing from drought is overtaken by a dangerous family who have taken over control of the water. Now with The Mexican arriving and staking a claim on his father's land things get even more heated in this indie western thriller.

programme.title: The Fighter
programme.desc: This fact-based drama follows boxer Micky Ward and his struggle to emerge from under the shadow of his half-brother Dicky Eklund, a former champion pugilist who lost his career to crack addiction.

programme.title: Enemy at the Gates
programme.desc: Set during the decisive Battle of Stalingrad, this spectacular World War II epic centers on a personal duel that develops between a celebrated Soviet sniper (Jude Law) and a Nazi sharpshooter (Ed Harris). The suspenseful story was directed by Jean-Jacques Annaud ("Seven Years in Tibet") and features an all-star cast that also includes Joseph Fiennes, Rachel Weisz, Bob Hoskins and Ron Perlman.

programme.title: Stillwater
programme.desc: Humble family man Bill Baker contends with the unthinkable when his daughter calls him from a French prison, revealing that she has been charged with murder. Determined to prove his daughter's innocence to the French courts and secure her freedom he embarks on an odyssey from rural Oklahoma to France driven by paternal instinct.
